Record.ClassificationPath: Bacterial Infections and Mycoses/Bacterial Infections/Gram-Positive Bacterial Infections/Actinomycetales Infections/Mycobacterium Infections/Tuberculosis/Peritonitis, Tuberculous
Record.Description: A form of PERITONITIS seen in patients with TUBERCULOSIS, characterized by lesion either as a miliary form or as a pelvic mass on the peritoneal surfaces. Most patients have ASCITES, abdominal swelling, ABDOMINAL PAIN, and other systemic symptoms such as FEVER; WEIGHT LOSS; and ANEMIA.
